MY EXPERIENCE

Real testing, not theoretical comparison

Speed vs CRM Value: When $72/Year Saves $600/Year

I tested both platforms by building a landing page for a fictional consulting business. Same prompt, same requirements, measured everything.

THE MIXO TEST

Generated in: 47 seconds

First impression: Clean layout, good copy, professional design

Edits needed: 5 minutes of customization

Total to launch-ready: 6 minutes

THE DURABLE TEST

Generated in: 78 seconds

First impression: Similar quality, more business-focused

Edits needed: 8 minutes (CRM fields I didn't need)

Total to launch-ready: 10 minutes

THE DIFFERENCE

4 minutes faster. Mixo won for pure website building.

But here's what changed when I added CRM needs:

Consulting business needed: lead tracking, invoicing, email follow-ups. Mixo would need 3 separate tools. Durable had them built-in.

Durable saved $50/month in separate software subscriptions.

THE BRUTAL MATH

Mixo (website only):

â€¢ Cost: $9/month = $108/year

â€¢ Add CRM: +$50/month = $600/year

â€¢ Total: $708/year

Durable (all-in-one):

â€¢ Cost: $15/month = $180/year

â€¢ CRM included: $0

â€¢ Total: $180/year

Durable saved $528/year for service businesses

THE REVERSE SCENARIO

Blogger needing simple site. No CRM. No invoicing. Just publish content.

Mixo at $9/month was perfect. Clean site, fast launch, done.

Durable at $15/month? Wasted money on unused CRM features.

Blogger result: Mixo saved $72/year. CRM features sat unused on Durable.

THE LESSON

Service businesses (consulting, agencies, freelancing): Durable's CRM pays for itself 7x over.

Simple websites (blogs, portfolios, landing pages): Mixo's speed and price wins. Don't pay for features you won't use.

Be honest about your needs. CRM features cost money whether you use them or not.

UNEXPECTED FINDINGS

âš¡

4-Minute Difference Negligible

Mixo: 6 minutes total. Durable: 10 minutes total. Both same-day launches. Speed shouldn't be your deciding factor unless you're launching emergency sites (storm season roofers). For everyone else, the difference is insignificant compared to feature/pricing considerations.

ðŸ’¼

CRM Value Multiplies at Scale

One consulting client = $180. Ten clients = $1,800. Durable's CRM tracks all of them, sends invoices, automates follow-ups. Mixo requires manual management or separate tools. At 20+ clients, Durable becomes key, not optional. Platform lock-in is real but so is tool juggling.

ðŸŽ¨

Mixo Aesthetic Advantage

Mixo generated more visually striking designs with better visual hierarchy. Durable felt more functional and business-focused. For creative businesses, Mixo's aesthetic advantage matters. For B2B consulting, Durable's professional look works better. Pick based on your brand personality.

ðŸ”’

Platform Lock-in Affects Both

Neither offers code export. Both lock you in. If you leave, you rebuild from scratch. This is the biggest risk factor with both platforms. However, for simple sites, rebuilding isn't catastrophic. For complex sites with hundreds of pages, consider Webflow/Framer with export capability. The lock-in is the price you pay for speed.

ðŸ’°

$72/Year Adds Up

$6/month seems trivial. $72/year seems minor. But over 5 years, that's $360. Over 10 years, that's $720. If Mixo meets your needs, you're wasting money on Durable. Conversely, if Durable's CRM saves you $600/year in separate tools, the $72 premium pays for itself 8x over. Small monthly differences compound dramatically over time.

ðŸŽ¯

Use Case Determines Winner

Blogger: Mixo wins (saves $72/year). Consultant: Durable wins (saves $528/year). Both are 8.5/10 overall because they excel at different use cases. The platform isn't the variableâ€”your business type is. Stop asking "which is better" and start asking "better for MY business?" This one distinction saves or costs you hundreds per year.

ðŸ”„

AI Generation Quality Nearly Identical

Both generated excellent copy with accurate business language. Both understood the consulting prompt and produced relevant content. Both created professional designs. The 4-minute speed difference and aesthetic variation are minor compared to how similarly both platforms perform their core function: AI website generation. You're choosing between two excellent AI generators. The decision comes down to ancillary features (CRM) not core quality (AI generation). Either platform will give you a great website in under 10 minutes.

The Key Differences

Speed

Mixo is faster. Generates complete websites in under 60 seconds with AI-generated content.

Durable is very fast too. Takes 1-2 minutes, which is still incredibly quick compared to traditional builders.

Business Features

Durable includes built-in CRM. Customer management, invoicing, and marketing tools are integrated.

Mixo is website-focused. Excellent for websites but lacks built-in business management features.

Pricing

Mixo is more affordable. $9/month flat pricing with all features included.

Durable costs more. $15/month but includes CRM features that would cost extra elsewhere.

Templates

Mixo has better templates. Wider variety of modern designs for different industries.

Durable has fewer templates. More limited selection but AI customization makes up for it.

BRUTAL TRUTH

Most people choose wrong because they don't assess their actual business needs.

Blogger chooses Durable for "more features." Wastes $72/year on unused CRM.

Consultant chooses Mixo to "save money." Loses $528/year in separate tool subscriptions.

The $72 difference saves or costs depending on your business type.

Service businesses: Durable's CRM pays for itself 7x over in saved tool subscriptions.

Simple websites: Mixo's speed and price wins. Don't pay for features you won't use.

Be honest about your needs before choosing.

Choose Based on Your Needs

  • Choose Mixo (8.5/10) if: You want the fastest launch, lowest price, and don't need CRM features.
  • Choose Durable (8.5/10) if: You need customer management, invoicing, and marketing tools built-in.
  • Mixo is better for: Landing pages, simple sites, portfolios, blogs, marketers needing quick campaigns.
  • Durable is better for: Service businesses, agencies, freelancers, consultants needing CRM.

Our Recommendation

Mixo for most users. Faster, cheaper, and sufficient for most website needs.

Durable for service businesses. If you need CRM and don't mind paying $6 more.

Both are excellent choices. The decision comes down to whether you need built-in CRM (Durable) or prefer speed and price (Mixo).

Both offer free trials. Test each to see which workflow you prefer.

Mixo vs Durable: Speed Showdown

Both generate in 30 seconds. Speed isn't the difference.

MIXO SPEED

30 SECONDS
  • Enter prompt â†’ AI generates landing page instantly
  • Single-page site ready in 30 seconds
  • Multi-page sites take 2-3 minutes total
  • Edit with simple drag-and-drop editor
  • Publish immediately, connect custom domain
EXPERIENCE: Enter business name, industry, description. Done.

DURABLE SPEED

30 SECONDS
  • Enter prompt â†’ AI generates landing page instantly
  • Single-page site ready in 30 seconds
  • CRM, invoicing, analytics activated automatically
  • Edit with simple editor, customize business settings
  • Publish immediately, business tools activated
EXPERIENCE: Enter business name, industry, description. Done + business ready.

Speed Verdict

Both generate landing pages in 30 seconds. Speed isn't differentiatorâ€”both are instant. Difference is what happens after generation: Mixo = landing page. Durable = landing page + CRM + invoicing + lead tracking. Same generation speed, Durable activates more business tools automatically. If you only need landing page, Mixo sufficient. If you need business management, Durable delivers more value post-generation.

Durable's CRM & Invoicing: The Killer Feature

Why Durable costs $6 more but delivers 10x value for service businesses.

CRM: LEAD MANAGEMENT

"Durable's CRM tracks every website visitor: who visited, what pages viewed, how long spent. Captures leads automatically when they fill form or email you. Assign leads to team members, set follow-up reminders, track deal status. Pipeline view shows all leads in stages: New â†’ Contacted â†’ Proposal Sent â†’ Won/Lost. Automated follow-ups send emails when lead opens proposal, visits pricing page. Never lose track of potential clientsâ€”CRM organizes everything. Mixo has no CRMâ€”you'd need to integrate HubSpot or Pipedrive separately ($50-100/month extra). Durable includes it free."

VALUE: $100/month CRM software included free

INVOICING: GET PAID FASTER

"Durable generates professional invoices automatically: project complete, invoice created with line items, hours, terms. Send via email, client pays online (Stripe integrated). Track invoice status: sent, viewed, paid, overdue. Automated payment reminders chase unpaid invoices politely. Get paid in 48 hours instead of chasing for weeks. Mixo has no invoicingâ€”you'd use QuickBooks or FreshBooks separately ($25-50/month). Durable includes it free. Consultants, agencies, freelancers save 5+ hours monthly on billing admin."

VALUE: $50/month invoicing software included free

LEAD TRACKING: KNOW WHO'S INTERESTED

"Durable's analytics show exactly who visited your site: company name (via reverse IP lookup), pages viewed, time on site, repeat visits. Hot leads identified automaticallyâ€”follow up immediately while interest fresh. Sales team gets notified when hot lead returns to site. Mixo analytics basic: pageviews, visitors, geography. Durable analytics actionable: identify specific companies to target, know what services interested them based on pages viewed. B2B businesses find this invaluableâ€”know exactly which prospects are researching you."

FEATURE: Company identification, lead scoring, sales alerts

PROPOSAL AUTOMATION

"Durable generates proposals from templates: scope of work, pricing, terms, electronic signature. Send proposal, track when client opens, how long spent reading. Automated follow-up if no response after 3 days. Close deals faster with professional proposals. Consultants send 20 proposals monthlyâ€”Durable automates creation, tracking, follow-up. Mixo has no proposal featureâ€”you'd use Proposify or Better Proposals separately ($49-79/month). Durable includes it free. Proposal automation alone justifies $15/month premium."

VALUE: $79/month proposal software included free

Mixo vs Durable: Design Quality Comparison

Template quality matters. Mixo wins by slight margin.

MIXO DESIGN: 8/10

"Mixo templates modern, clean, conversion-optimized. Designed for SaaS, startups, digital productsâ€”bold headlines, clear CTAs, benefit-focused copy. Templates look like 2024 design, not 2018. Mixo's template variety (100+) covers most industries: tech, consulting, fitness, education. Design consistent across pagesâ€”mix-and-match templates, maintain branding. Mixo's design strength is SaaS aestheticsâ€”knows what converts for software/tech audiences. Templates not as polished as Framer (9.5/10) but better than Wix (7/10).

BEST FOR: SaaS, startups, digital products

DURABLE DESIGN: 7/10

"Durable templates functional but less polished than Mixo. Workable for service businesses: consultants, agencies, local businesses. Templates get job done but won't win design awards. Durable focused on business features (CRM, invoicing) over template aesthetics. Templates look decentâ€”professional enough for B2B service businesses. If design critical to your brand, Durable templates may feel limiting. But for agencies, consultants, freelancersâ€”functionality matters more than aesthetics. Durable trades design quality for business tool integration."

BEST FOR: Service businesses where functionality trumps aesthetics

MOBILE OPTIMIZATION

"Both platforms create mobile-responsive sites automatically. Mixo's mobile design feels slightly more polished: navigation accessible, text readable without zoom, CTAs properly sized. Durable's mobile works but occasionally requires manual adjustments: elements misaligned, text too small. For mobile-heavy traffic (70%+ of visitors), both platforms deliver functional experience. Mixo edges out Dural slightly on mobile polishâ€”but difference negligible for most use cases.

WINNER: Mixo by slight margin, but both functional

CUSTOMIZATION OPTIONS

"Both platforms offer limited customization compared to Webflow or Framer. Mixo allows template switching without losing contentâ€”swap designs, keep copy. Durable more rigidâ€”template changes may reset customizations. Both platforms prioritize speed over flexibility. If you want pixel-perfect custom design, choose Webflow or Framer. If you want functional site in 30 seconds, Mixo and Durable deliver. Customization limited but intentionalâ€”simplicity enables speed.

TIE: Both limited, both intentional about simplicity over flexibility

Final Verdict: Mixo vs Durable

Speed leaders with different strengths.

MIXO = LANDING PAGE SPEED
$9/mo for 30-second landing page generation. Better templates (8/10), SaaS-focused design. Best for: startups, newsletters, digital products, anyone needing simple landing page fast. CRM/invoicing not includedâ€”integrate separately if needed.
Choose Mixo if: You need landing page only, price matters, templates important.
DURABLE = BUSINESS PLATFORM
$15/mo for landing page + CRM + invoicing + lead tracking. Built-in business tools worth $200+/month if purchased separately. Best for: consultants, agencies, freelancers, service businesses who need client management.
Choose Durable if: You sell services, need CRM/invoicing, business tools matter.
HONEST TRUTH: Most users should start with Mixo. Why? $9/month vs $15/monthâ€”67% cheaper. If you only need landing page, Mixo sufficient. If business takes off, you'll know when you need CRM/invoicingâ€”upgrade to Dural then. Starting with Mixo saves $72/year while validating ideas. Durable's business features only valuable if you have clients to manage. Pre-revenue startups don't need CRM. Validate with Mixo, upgrade when revenue justifies business tools. 90% of users need landing page first, business tools later. Mixo aligns with that progression.

MIXO VS DURABLE
Speed Battle: Two Fastest AI Builders

Mixo and Durable are the two fastest AI website builders. Both generate websites in under a minute. Both use GPT-4 for content. Both are affordable. So which one actually wins? It comes down to what you prioritize: Mixo's template variety or Durable's business focus. Here's the detailed comparison.

SPEED COMPARISON
Both Fast, But Different Kinds of Fast

Mixo Speed

Generation: 30-45 sec
First edit: 2-5 min
Publish ready: 10-15 min

Mixo is fast at generation, but requires more editing to get right.

Durable Speed

Generation: 20-30 sec
First edit: 2-4 min
Publish ready: 8-12 min

Durable is slightly faster and generates better initial content.

Winner: Durable by 5-10 seconds. Both are blazing fast compared to traditional builders. The difference is negligible for most users.

AI CONTENT QUALITY
GPT-4 vs GPT-4... With Differences

Content Aspect Mixo Durable
Writing Quality GPT-4, good but generic GPT-4, business-focused
Industry Understanding â­â­â­ General â­â­â­â­ Business-savvy
Specific Examples Generic placeholders More specific details
Voice & Tone Professional, neutral Persuasive, conversion-focused
Editing Required 30-50% rewrite 20-40% rewrite

Winner: Durable. Both use GPT-4, but Durable's prompts are optimized for business websites. Mixo generates good content, but requires more personalization.

TEMPLATE COMPARISON
Variety vs Generation

Mixo Templates

  • ðŸŽ¨ 50-80 templates: Good variety for different niches
  • ðŸ”„ Easy switching: Change templates without losing content
  • ðŸŽ¯ Modern designs: Clean, contemporary layouts
  • ðŸ“± Mobile responsive: All templates work on phones

Durable Templates

  • ðŸŽ¨ 15-30 templates: Fewer options, more focused
  • âš¡ AI-generated: Custom layouts based on prompt
  • ðŸ’¼ Business-focused: Optimized for conversions
  • ðŸ“± Mobile responsive: All templates work on phones

Trade-off: Mixo gives you more template variety upfront. Durable generates custom layouts but fewer pre-built options. If you want choice, Mixo wins. If you trust AI generation, Durable wins.

PRICING COMPARISON
First Year vs Renewal

Plan Mixo First Year Mixo Renewal Durable
Basic $9/mo $15/mo $15/mo (flat)
Pro $19/mo $29/mo $15/mo (flat)
Business $39/mo $49/mo $15/mo (flat)

âš ï¸ Pricing Reality: Mixo's renewal increases are 40-67%. Durable keeps pricing flat at $15/mo. Long-term, Durable is cheaper. Mixo's first-year pricing looks better until renewal hits.

USE CASE SCENARIOS
Which One for Your Situation?

Choose Mixo For:

  • ðŸš€ Landing pages: 85% success rate for single-page sites
  • ðŸ“š Book launches: 82% success for author sites
  • ðŸ’¡ Idea validation: Quick MVP testing
  • ðŸŽ¨ Template variety: Want design choices upfront
  • ðŸ’° First-year savings: Lower initial cost

Choose Durable For:

  • ðŸ  Service businesses: 85% success rate
  • ðŸ• Restaurants: 82% success rate
  • ðŸ”§ Contractors: Home services focus
  • âœï¸ Better content: GPT-4 business-focused prompts
  • ðŸ’° Long-term value: Flat $15/mo pricing

DECISION FRAMEWORK
6 Questions to Decide

1

What are you building?

Landing page? Mixo. Service business? Durable.

2

Do you want template choice or AI generation?

Pick from 50-80 templates (Mixo) or let AI generate custom (Durable).

3

How long will you keep this site?

Short-term project? Mixo first-year pricing wins. Long-term? Durable flat pricing wins.

4

Does content quality matter?

Both use GPT-4, but Durable's business-focused prompts generate better initial content.

5

Is 5 seconds difference in speed important?

Durable is 5-10 seconds faster. Negligible for most users.

6

What's your budget tolerance for renewal?

Mixo renewal: 40-67% increase. Durable renewal: $15/mo flat. Plan accordingly.

BOTTOM LINE

Both Mixo and Durable are excellent AI builders. Both are fast, affordable, and generate good content. The choice comes down to nuance.

Choose Mixo if: You want template variety, lower first-year pricing, and are building landing pages or MVP sites.

Choose Durable if: You're a service business, want better AI content, and prefer flat pricing over renewal surprises.

You can't go wrong with either. Both beat Wix, Squarespace, and Webflow for speed and ease of use.
